instruction: From the words lettered A to E, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences.

questions.question: The governor ordered that the work done by any contractor should be properly _____ so as to know the correct amount to pay.
The new teacher tried to ______ discipline among the students.
The chairman could not attend the meeting because he was ______ engaged elsewhere.
We were asked to submit our forms before the deadline, but many students did so ______.
The principal urged the prefects to ______ the younger students in their duties.
The players were applauded for their ______ performance at the final match.
Many students find it difficult to pay attention because they are easily ______.
The journalist was warned not to ______ any false information to the public.
The doctor advised him to desist from smoking to ______ his health.
The police officer promised to ______ the case without fear or favour.
The workers were angry because their salaries had been ______ for three months.
It is wrong to make promises that you cannot ______.
The examiners praised the candidate for writing a very ______ essay.
He could not win the race because he ______ training for weeks.
The suspect was released because there was no ______ evidence against him.

instruction: After each sentence, choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate.

questions.question: When the chairman saw that the argument was getting out of hand, he decided to call a spade a spade. This means that
The students took the law into their own hands. This means that they
The teacher's warning fell on deaf ears. This means that
options: the students pretended not to hear

questions.question: The new policy has raised a storm in a teacup.
options: The problem is out of control

questions.question: The young man is at his wit’s end. This means that he
The chairman paid lip service to the welfare of the workers.
The candidate promised to fight tooth and nail to win the election.
The manager decided to wash his hands off the project.
The woman suddenly broke down in tears.
The soldiers were ordered to lay down their arms.
options: They were told to continue fighting

instruction: From the words lettered A to E, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word.

questions.question: The teacher was impressed by the boy’s <u>candour.</u>
The chairman delivered a <u>succinct</u> report.
The new evidence <u>corroborates</u> the witness’s statement.
The manager’s <u>resilience</u> helped him overcome challenges.
His <u>affluent</u> lifestyle made him popular in the city.
The speaker’s words were <u>inflammatory.</u>
The lawyer made a <u>vehement</u> appeal to the jury.
The boy gave a <u>vivid</u> description of the incident.
The students were asked to submit <u>duplicate</u> copies of their forms.
His <u>negligence</u> cost the company a lot of money.

instruction: From the words lettered A to E, choose the word opposite in meaning to the underlined word.

questions.question: The principal <u>commended</u> the teacher for his hard work.
The witness <u>affirmed</u> that the accused was guilty.
The old man’s health is now <u>stable.</u>
The suspect was <u>reluctant</u> to confess his crime.
The manager’s attitude towards the workers was <u>harsh.</u>
The debate ended on a <u>cordial</u> note.
The student’s essay was <u>lucid</u> and well-organized.
The man’s story was <u>credible.</u>
The judge’s decision was <u>unbiased.</u>
The manager’s office was <u>immaculate.</u>

instruction: Choose the word that has the same vowel or consonant sound as indicated.

questions.question: From the words lettered A to E, choose the word that has the same vowel sound as the underlined letters in w<u>oo</u>d.
From the words lettered A to E, choose the word that has the same vowel sound as the underlined letter in b<u>ea</u>d.
Identify the word that has the same vowel sound as /ɜː/.
From the words lettered A to E, choose the word that has the same consonant sound as the underlined letter in <u>ph</u>one.
From the words lettered A to E, choose the word that has the same consonant sound as the underlined letter in <u>ch</u>urch.
Identify the word that has the same consonant sound as /ʃ/ in she.

instruction: Choose the correct answer for each question.

questions.question: Choose the word that rhymes with gate.
Choose the word that rhymes with pool.
Choose the word that rhymes with bake.
Choose the option that shows the correct stress for conversation.
Choose the option that shows the correct stress for economics.
Choose the option that shows the correct stress for photograph.
He bought a NEW car yesterday.
options: Did he sell a new car yesterday?
Did he buy an old car yesterday?
Did he buy a new house yesterday?
Did he buy a new car today?
Did he buy a new bicycle yesterday?
questions.answer: Did he buy an old car yesterday?

questions.question: The students PASSED the examination.
options: Did the teachers pass the examination?
Did the students fail the examination?
Did the students pass the test?
Did the students sit for the examination?
Did the teachers mark the examination?
questions.answer: Did the students fail the examination?

questions.question: The children are playing in the GARDEN.
options: Are the children sleeping in the garden?
Are the children playing in the field?
Are the adults playing in the garden?
Are the children playing in the house?
Are the children hiding in the garden?
questions.answer: Are the children playing in the field?
